summary:
Over the past ten years I have worked in the domain of soil and water resources management and governance – covering water and agriculture (irrigation), groundwater, drinking water supply, landuse and catchment management. I have been involved in both on the ground projects such as irrigation feasibility studies (field and stakeholder) surveys; as well as the preparation of sector studies such as National Water Integrity Studies (Ghana and Kenya) and Irrigation sector diagnostic and strategy study (Yemen); and strategic policy studies such as the Multi Annual Strategic Plan (Netherlands Embassy in Yemen).
Currently I am involved in a.o. in Tanzania, developing district and village level NRM action plans as well as Farmer Field School trainings; and in Ethiopia, developing water sources protection plans.
Over the years I have acquired well balanced experience in both subject matter as well as project formulation (proposal), project coordination and management aspects. He is a member of the 3R secretariat - with 3R standing for Recharge, Retention and Reuse – aiming to put groundwater recharge, retention central in agriculture land and water management.

projects.title: Consultancy Services for the Groundwater and Soil Conservation Project – Beneficiary Impact Assessment (BIA)
projects.description:
For the Ministry of Agriculture and Irrigation Groundwater and Soil Conservation Project (GSCP), assess the impact of the GSCP project results under the three components on the beneficiaries with three goals: (a) improved irrigation water use efficiency; (b) improved recharge and protection of watersheds; and (c) support the groundwater management framework and institutions.
Role: Irrigation engineering and groundwater water specialist
Specific activities: Initial coordination with the client; formulation of: questionnaires, focus group discussions sheets and field survey data sheets

projects.title: Strengthening the Water and Environment Center (Nuffic, NPT/YEM/036)
Strengthening research capacity in Yemen’s water sector for policy formulation, education and awareness raising (NICHE/027YEM)
projects.description:
The (nuffic financed) project aims to develop: new group of water thinkers, relevant research programs, an inter-disciplinary educational program, structural linkage to the water sector and gender mainstreaming.
Role: Coordinator, groundwater and agriculture researcher
Specific activities: Project coordination; Labour market assessment; Water sector partnership; Business support; Research theme development

projects.title: Water Harvesting for Rainfed Africa: investing in dryland agriculture for growth and resilience (WAHARA)
projects.description:
This EU-funded (FP7) research project aims to develop: water harvesting solutions applicable beyond local study sites and indeed across the continent. Applying, analysing and learning from four countries including: Burkina Faso, Ethiopia, Tunisia and Zambia; MetaMeta’s role is to develop guidelines to facilitate stakeholder learning and action about WH technologies in different (biophysical and socioeconomic) conditions as well as farmer learning, enabling policies and (continent wide) implementing strategies.
Role: Work package 6 coordinator
Specific activities: Coordination of MetaMeta research input; Documentation of knowledge sharing/ dissemination practice of water harvesting techniques; etc.

projects.title: Groundwater in the Political Domain

projects.title: Tubewells in Flood Plains
projects.description:
Project: Supported by the Partners voor Water facility of RVO, this pilot project looks at the potential of: systematic introduction of hand drilled shallow tube wells in flood plain areas that can be capped during rainy/ flooding seasons. To allow more secure supply of irrigation water and enhance the yield of high value crops during the main harvest (flood period) and the dry season.
Role: Assistant project coordinator
Specific activities: 
-	coordinating consortium activities, outputs, reports and project finances
-	review of field results, and compiling reports

projects.title: Consulting Service for Feasibility Studies and Participatory Planning of Group 1 Sites and Prefeasibility Studies of Group 2 Sites (as part of IDSP)
projects.description:
Project: For the Ministry of Agriculture and Livestock (MAL), Zambia, Preparing irrigation feasibility reports for 3 sites and irrigation pre-feasibility reports for 4 other sites in Zambia.
Role: Assistant rural sociologist and agronomist
Specific activities: Assisting the socio-economic and agronomic baseline field survey (pre) feasibility studies of 7 sites; Review of irrigation agronomy and agro-economic reporting inputs; Coordination of local enumerating project team

projects.title: Consulting Services for Study on the Irrigation Sector Strategy (NIP)
projects.description:
Project: This project aims to develop: an irrigation sector strategy, decentralised coordination (with water users associations being topical) and develop suggestions for restructuring of irrigation sector organisations to come to a sustainable sector lookout in the medium and long run.
Role: international team leader
Specific activities: work management and planning; coordination of national consultants; co-writing of diagnostic survey of the agriculture and water sector (water resources and irrigation)

projects.title: Consultancy Service for Master Plan Review, Catchment Rehabilitation and Awareness Creation for Geffersa, Legedadi, and Dire Catchment Areas
projects.description:
The client Addis Ababa Water and Sewerage Authority (supported by WB) aimed to implement: 
- rehabilitation the degraded catchments to minimize risk of siltation into the dams
- improving overall water quality
- raising the holding capacity of the dams
Role: WRM Specialist
Specific activities: Teamback stopping, writing and review of catchment rehabilitation, farming and afforestation reports; and Management and coordination of project team

projects.title: Provide building blocks for a water policy framework: formulating the Multi-Annual Strategic Plans (MASP) for 2012-2015 of the Embassy of the Kingdom of the Netherlands (EKN) of Yemen.
projects.description:
For the Netherlands Ministry of Foreign Affairs working out of the new development policy of the EKN focussing on an integrated approach to peace, security and development, which will form the core of the programme.
Role: WRM specialist
Specific activities:
- Study of available WRM documentation of Yemen
- Prepare context analysis en binding constraints
- Formulate preliminary country outcomes and outputs based on the results of the analysis for water and the linkage with security and rule of law’ and relevant (cross-cutting) themes, i.e. private sector development, governance and gender.

projects.title: Transparency in Service Delivery in Africa (TISDA), Water Sector Consultant
projects.description:
As part of the Transparency in Service Delivery in Africa (TISDA) project the integrity and performance of the water sectors in Senegal, Ghana and Kenya is analysed and documented in National Integrity studies.
Role: Water Service Provision Specialist (external consultant)
Specific activities: Writing of 3 development case studies, water services provision and sector financing; Review of 8 water supply provision case studies; Write-up of the Ghana and Kenyan National Water Sector Integrity Studies

projects.title: Restoration of tropical peatland to promote sustainable use of renewable natural resources (RESTORPEAT)
projects.description:
Investigating the ‘Practical use of a hydrological model for the restoration of tropical peatlands in Central Kalimantan, Indonesia’
B.Sc. student researcher
-	fieldwork in Sebangau National Park (Natural Laboratory of Peat-swamp Forest - LAHG) including: demarcating area of interest, building smalls dams en measuring their effect, GPS surveying
-	visualisation of groundwater fluctuations, using the hydrological model SIMGRO in combination with Alterraqua and Remote Sensing applications 
-	assessment of the soil characteristics, land use forms and the climatological and hydrological situation and the construction of dams of which the effect has then been measured and analysed
